questions.text: A 22-year-old male presents to the emergency room with a deep laceration on his foot sustained while working in his garden. The wound is dirty and the patient reports that he has not received a tetanus shot in over 10 years. The healthcare provider decides to administer tetanus prophylaxis. Which of the following options is the best choice for tetanus prophylaxis in this patient?

choices.text: Tetanus toxoid vaccine with tetanus immune globulin (TIG)
Tetanus immune globulin (TIG) followed by tetanus toxoid vaccine

questions.solution:
Option B

  • In this case, the best choice for tetanus prophylaxis is a combination of tetanus toxoid vaccine and tetanus immune globulin (TIG). Tetanus is caused by the toxin produced by the bacterium Clostridium tetani, which can be found in soil and manure. The deep, dirty wound and the patient's lack of recent tetanus vaccination put him at high risk for developing tetanus. Tetanus prophylaxis is indicated for all wounds that are dirty, deep, or puncture wounds.

Why other choices are Incorrect

Option A: Tetanus toxoid vaccine alone is not sufficient for this patient because it does not provide immediate protection against tetanus. It takes several days for the vaccine to stimulate an immune response and provide protection. In the meantime, the patient is at risk for developing tetanus.

Option C:  Tetanus immune globulin (TIG) alone is also not sufficient because it does not provide long-term protection against tetanus. TIG is a passive form of immunity that provides immediate protection against tetanus, but the protection is temporary and lasts only a few weeks.

Option D: Tetanus immune globulin (TIG) followed by tetanus toxoid vaccine, is not the best choice because the two components can be given together, and waiting to give the vaccine could put the patient at risk for developing tetanus.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of fever, weight loss, and a persistent cough. On further questioning, he admits to have multiple sexual partners and having used intravenous drugs in the past. Laboratory testing reveals a low CD4 count. Which of the following statements regarding the epidemiology of this disease is correct?

choices.text: The majority of this infection worldwide occur through heterosexual transmission.
The incidence of this disease is decreasing in all age groups in the United States.
Intravenous drug use is the primary mode of transmission for this disease in sub-Saharan Africa.
It disproportionately affects men who have sex with men in high-income countries.

questions.solution:
Option A:

  • The disease that the question is implying towards is HIV/AIDS, also suggested by the history of multiple sexual partners & low CD4 count. 
  • While the mode of transmission of HIV can vary by region, globally, heterosexual transmission is the most common mode of HIV transmission. According to UNAIDS, in 2020, approximately 62% of new HIV infections occurred through heterosexual transmission. Intravenous drug use is a significant mode of transmission in some regions, such as in Eastern Europe and Central Asia.

Why other options are incorrect

Option B: is incorrect as the incidence of HIV/AIDS is not decreasing in all age groups in the United States. 

Option C: is incorrect as intravenous drug use is a significant mode of transmission in some regions, but not the primary mode of transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. 

Option D: is incorrect as men who have sex with men continue to be disproportionately affected by HIV/AIDS in high-income countries, but this is not the only group affected.

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct method of segregating biomedical waste?

choices.text: Segregate based on color coding alone
Segregate based on type and color coding
Segregate based on quantity and color coding
Segregate based on location and color coding

questions.solution:
Option B 

  • The correct method of segregating biomedical waste is to segregate it based on type of waste and color coding. Biomedical waste should be segregated into different categories such as infectious waste, sharps waste, chemical waste, and so on, depending on the type of waste generated in a healthcare facility. Each category of waste has a different color code assigned to it for easy identification and disposal. 

Why are the other options incorrect
Options A,C,D:  Are not the correct method of segregation, as it does not provide information on the type of waste being generated.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccine types provide the longest duration of protection?
questions.solution:
Option C:

  • Subunit, recombinant, or conjugate vaccines contain purified protein subunits or fragments of the pathogen, which are less likely to cause adverse reactions than live attenuated or inactivated vaccines. These vaccines also stimulate a strong and long-lasting immune response, leading to a longer duration of protection. 

Why other options are incorrect

Option A: is incorrect because although live attenuated vaccines provide long-lasting protection, they carry a small risk of causing disease in individuals with weakened immune systems.

Option B: is incorrect because inactivated vaccines provide a shorter duration of protection than subunit, recombinant, or conjugate vaccines.

Option D: is incorrect because DNA vaccines are still experimental and not yet widely available for human use.

questions.text: A large-scale study is conducted to determine the occurrence of a disease in a particular population over a five-year period. At the beginning of the study, there were 1,000 individuals in the population who were free of the disease. After five years, 100 new cases of the disease were diagnosed. What is the incidence rate of the disease in this population over the five-year period?
questions.solution:
Option B

  • Incidence rate is the number of new cases of a disease that occur in a defined population over a specified time period. In this case, the incidence rate can be calculated as follows:
  • Incidence rate = number of new cases of disease during the time period / total population at risk during the time period 
  • So, the incidence rate in this population would be 100/1000 = 0.1.

Why other choices are incorrect

Option A: is incorrect because it is the proportion of new cases to the total population, which is not the same as the incidence rate.

Option C: is incorrect because it is the total number of cases in the population at a particular point in time, not the incidence rate.

Option D: is incorrect because it is not a valid rate and does not represent the incidence rate

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents with a pruritic rash and fever. The rash started on his face and  spreads to his trunk and extremities. On examination, you notice multiple papules and vesicles with an erythematous base. The patient reports feeling unwell and has not been vaccinated against this disease. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Option C

  • The clinical presentation is consistent with VZV infection, commonly known as chickenpox. Measles typically present with a rash that starts behind the ear rather than on face and spreads to the trunk and extremities, in rubella although it starts from face but the nature in these two conditions is maculopapular & not vesicular. Smallpox has been eradicated, and the patient's age, as well as the nature of the rash, is not consistent with this diagnosis.

Why other choices are incorrect

Option A: Measles - Incorrect
The rash in measles is maculopapular rather than vesicular, and the rash does not start on the face but rather behind the ears before spreading to the face, trunk, and extremities.

Option B: Rubella - Incorrect
The rash in rubella is maculopapular rather than vesicular, though the rash typically starts on the face and spreads to the trunk and extremities.

Option D: Smallpox - Incorrect
Smallpox has been eradicated, and the patient's age, as well as the nature of the rash, is not consistent with this diagnosis.

questions.text: What is the primary objective of the National Nutrition Mission/POSHAN Abhiyaan?

choices.text: To reduce the prevalence of stunting, under-nutrition, anemia, and low birth weight
To increase the overall food production in the country
To provide financial assistance to the farmers for the cultivation of nutritious crops
To establish more hospitals and health centers across the country

questions.solution:
Option A

  • The National Nutrition Mission/POSHAN Abhiyaan is a flagship program of the Indian government launched in 2018 with the objective of improving the nutritional status of children and women in the country. The primary objective of the program is to reduce the prevalence of stunting, undernutrition, anemia, and low birth weight. It aims to achieve this objective by implementing various interventions such as the promotion of optimal breastfeeding practices, the use of fortified foods, the provision of micronutrient supplements, and the promotion of healthy dietary habits.

Why are the other choices Incorrect

Option B: is incorrect because while the mission aims to improve nutrition, it is not focused on increasing food production in the country. 

Option C: is incorrect because while the mission may promote the cultivation of nutritious crops, it does not provide financial assistance to farmers for this purpose.

Option D: is incorrect because the mission's primary focus is on improving nutrition and not on establishing more hospitals or health centers.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of mild water contamination?
questions.solution:
Option C

  • Water contamination can have different degrees of severity, ranging from mild to severe. Mild water contamination refers to the presence of substances in the water that do not pose an immediate threat to human health, but may cause long-term health effects or have other negative impacts. Organic pollutants are an example of mild water contamination, as they can come from a variety of sources such as pesticides, industrial chemicals, and sewage. Exposure to organic pollutants over time can lead to chronic health effects such as cancer, birth defects, and reproductive problems.

Why are other choices incorrect

Option A: Presence of pathogenic bacteria is an example of severe water contamination, as these bacteria can cause immediate illness and even death.

Option B: Presence of heavy metals is also an example of severe water contamination, as heavy metals such as lead, arsenic, and mercury can cause serious health effects even in small amounts.

Option D: Presence of radioactive substances is also an example of severe water contamination, as exposure to radioactive substances can cause immediate illness and long-term health effects such as cancer.
